I can't wait to stay there next week as I have a hot date with a bowl of soup!
author: Sparkely K.

description: Three of us ordered the Halibut last night.  All of us thought it was one of the worst meals of our lives.  I have eated fish in most of the neighborhoods of San Francisco over the last 50 years, and the Fish and Chips found anywhere are better than this crap they served us.  Obviously frozen, prepared patties, they were bland and tasteless... and this is Halibut?  The best tasting fish you can order anywhere.  All of us would have preferred Miss Grotton's frozen stuff.  The Clam Chowder was first rate, but that's not exactly what we ordered.  This dinner was totally disgraceful!
author: Mike K.

description:
Location is great since it's in the Hyatt Regency Hotel on the Embarcadero.  You have the pretty lights and get to look up at the hotel rooms.  Ambiance is nice with the cool couches and pillows.

Happy hour food specials were a bit sad with hummus/chips or olives or chips and salsa.  $3 for any one of them.  Portions are a bit small and was just ok.

Service was a bit slow.
author: Denice L.

description: Pretty space, pricey drinks (~$14 during their "happy" hour), slow staff, but it's open on the weekends, unlike pretty much anything else in this area.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Good place for discussion, tables well spaced out for private conversation and suitable for work

Food not great at all

Would recommend to go for coffee or drinks if you need a nice place to take someone to discuss business
author: Dindy H.

description: We stopped by to see all the Christmas decor.  The hotel lights are breathtaking.  Decided on our way to a party, to have cocktails and apps.  It seemed short staffed, self seating, which seems to confuse the waiters.  We got our apps, before our drinks as the bartender was also by herself and backed up.  The food runner, was just going to drop the food and leave. I asked him if he could bring plates, and utensils.  It just didn't dawn on him, that we would need those things.  This is a union hotel, I know they are making decent money.  Hyatt should have trained him better, before letting him hit the floor.   When we saw our waiter, he was great.  He was just too busy, to spend much time with his tables.  Don't think I would return.
author: tonya m.

description:
After flying in from the East Coast and wandering around SF getting the tourist out of my system for a couple hours, I was pretty tired and ready for dinner.  I'd had a big lunch so I just wanted something simple and small.  I ended up going to the Eclipse Restaurant in the Hyatt Regency in the Embarcadero area of SF.  I decided on eating here because they had soups, salads, and "small plates."  

The restaurant's menu had lots of good options, and I appreciated how the restaurant used local, organic, and sustainable ingredients.  I got the "small plate" of crab cakes, which were some of the best crab cakes I've ever had.  They had a nice, crispy crust and great texture between the outside and inside.  The 2 sauces, a creamy one and balsamic one, served with the dish were very tasty - I ate both of them right up with the crab cakes since the flavors went well together.  I also really liked the side dish of sweet corn and jicama - it was very refreshing and I found the whole meal to be simply delicious.

For dessert, I had the Ferry Building Farmer's Market Seasonal Fruit Cobbler with Streusal Topping.  The seasonal fruit filling was made of apples and cherries and the dish was topped with ice cream.  The plate was HUGE AND was quite tasty.  I only ate about 1/2 of it because it was so big.  

The restaurant was pretty quite as I went in pretty late around 9pm.  There were a few random business people scattered about but the place was pretty quiet and I liked the relaxing low-lit space.  The atrium is pretty neat looking with lots of plants along the interior balconies and funky-looking elevators.

The waitress was very nice and took good care of me.  She was very friendly and could see that I wanted to have a slow, relaxing meal and gave me plenty of space.  She also got all my food to me promptly so I was comfortable but not waiting on her.  A man in a suit, presumably the manager, even stopped by to check in on how I was doing.

My meal was slow, steady, and relaxing and made the perfect end to a long, busy day.  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and look forward to returning.
author: Diana B.

description:
Yelp should have a zero star option. 

I went there with a few friends for lunch.  We chose from the dine about town menu.  There was not much to choose from, it was either a salad, salmon burger or the steak sandwich.  The waiter recommended the steak sandwich.  Most of us ordered the steak sandwich and the rest, the salmon burger.

The salmon burger was...gross. It tasted like fish bait.  I couldn't even finish 1/4 of my burger.  The steak sandwich was just as bad.  It was flavorless and really chewy.

The service was bad.  The waiter kept on taking our fries when we asked them not to...and they hardly refilled our waters.

In short, I will never come back to this place.
author: nancy b.

description: Had a nice lunch with a friend here yesterday. Nice array of menu choices for lunch--salads, sandwiches and hot entrees. Very gracious and attentive service. It's a nice space to the side of the dramatic lobby. What I especially appreciated was the quiet. We could actually have a nice conversation without the need to shout. This is a rarity in the neighborhood! A little pricey, but good food in a lovely atmosphere and great service.
author: Joanna S.

description: I came here for lunch during Dine About Town. The food was fine... not bad, but nothing too special. For DAT it was a good deal, but I don't think the food is worth the prices they charge. The reason this places gets four stars is because of the amazing service. Eddie and Tony were both friendly and attentive, and they really made the experience great. I'm not dying to go back for the food, but I do want to go back because of the service. If you come here duing the day, ask to sit in Eddie's section!
author: Alison B.

description:
My group of girls came here for a bachelorette party weekend under and employee rate. This employee rate let us eat at the restaurant for half off. I was pretty sad that the menu was so limited as opposed to the in dining menu. 3 of us came to eat and start drinking before another night out. One of us got clam chowder, another got the quesadilla and I got the garlic and chicken pizza along with a bloody mary, a mojito and I got a dirty martini. The quesadilla came out and looked like taquitos. Plating wasn't really anything special, probably the same way they would plate at an Applebee's. The seating was nice, it had a lounge feel to it. We were really confused when we walked up because no one greeted us or told us where we could sit so after a few minutes of standing we sat down at the end of the bar. I'm not sure about everyone else food and drink but my pizza was yummy, the bartender (Bobbi, I think) looked at me as if she knew I wouldn't finish it and brought extra plates for me to share but I eat a lot and even though I only ate half my pizza, I definitely looked forward to eat the rest of it when we came back from the club. My dirty vodka martini was also pretty good, not too olive-y and not too vodka-y. I think our bill came out to around $60, but like I said, half off the food and happy hour drinks. Happy hour is from 4:30-7:30 EVERYDAY. Not the best service but some of the servers were really helpful when we were planning our bar-hopping before clubbing.

They have normal bar food, burgers, salads, soups, pizzas. Not much else.
author: Mariko B.

description:
A nice lunch time treat for a friend and I.  The angus burger and garlic fries for her, kobe sliders, clam chowder and a small salad for me.  Mine was part of a lunch special - select an entree and two sides.  Everything was delicious.  Could stop myself from eating my friends garlic fries.  

Friendly service.  Even the manager checked in on us a couple of times.  

My favorite time to come to this restaurant is during Christmas when the hotel really takes advantage of the open space - filling it with lights and beautiful decorations.
author: Denise M.

description: we stood around waiting to be sitted (and it wasnt busy at all) , until we finally gave up and sat down on our own. We waited and no one came to give us menus. My date went and spoke to the waitress to ask if we could get menus. Then he spoke to the hostess, explaied that we never got seated and that we needed menus. They never came over and we left. Would never go back
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Patio dining under the stars.  Sort of.  

Except the patio was the 3rd-floor lobby of the Hyatt Regency, and the stars were track lights hung high overhead in the 18-story atrium.  About 8 stories up, the hallways and rooms hung directly overhead.  The spaciousness was accented by a skylight way up over the 18th floor. Flowers and trees in the cafe helped create the outdoor illusion.  The flowers were real, the trees were fake.  For a moment I was transported to the Blue Bayou in Disneyland.  

A HOT Russian girl had invited me to meet her here.  Quiet groups of businesspeople gathered around the tables.  Suits and ties were all that we saw in this half-filled, little-known haven.  It was clearly an expense-account rendezvous.  

She had tea and a Caesar salad with crab cakes.  I discovered the new menu section of "signature trios," and ordered the Caesar, two crab cake sliders, and french fries, with a diet Coke.  The HOT Russian girl paid the bill, $51 plus tip.  

Two paid-for lunches in two weeks!  I'm on a roll here!
author: David D.

description: This is definitely a happening little spot burried inside the Hyatt Regency.  Great food, a great bar and great service!  Can you really ever ask for anything more? I 'm definitely a fan!!
author: Toia C.

description: I've been here probably half a dozen or so times with my boss, as its his favorite place for lunch.  Consequently, I've never had to pay, and that I'm glad of.  The service is usually okay, but if you catch someone at the end of their shift they will definitely let you know it.  I think they are used to tourists who they will never see again.  There's usually a vegetarian option or two, but nothing is all that memorable or remarkable.  My boss's chicken Caesars he always gets look really dry and unappetizing.  Its kind of a standby though because you know they will have something for everyone and will very likely have a table.  Because its in an enormous atrium the acoustics are kind of strange and if you're with more than one person it can be hard to hear.  Its also kind of drafty.   Overall:  meh with a side of shrug.
author: Molly B.

description: Nice place to relax and unwind. Just don't expect rapid service or even semi decently speedy service. Apparently if you can drink a beer in less than 20 minutes, you still don't get another until that 20 is up. Or so it seemed. Strawberry mojito is a thick puree that settles and the wife preferred water after the first one.
author: James H.

description: Food was ok, but service was horrible. The server was oddly hostile as soon as she arrived at the table, acting incredulous when  someone in our party asked what was included in the breakfast buffet, and finding a way to sarcastically describe a menu item.  This wasn't a demanding crowd, she was just awful. Further, an assistant server essentially argued with us when one person asked for an extra saucer of ketchup. It was strange and made for an unpleasant dining experience.
author: Robert W.

description: my place to get my drink on n hav a conversation wif business ppl and hot ppl alike lol.
author: Linda A.

description:
Pretty relax, spacious bar/seating area.  Only 1 bartender who tends to be a tad snippy as there is steady business.

You get to see X'mas lights & a tree.  Some cute display of miniature railroad set was in the lobby area.
author: Jboogie L.

description: I had lunch here  with my girlfriends for dine about town. The salmon burger was too fishy and the service was horrible. I would never come back.
author: Angela T.

description:
Yes this does restaurant does situate inside a hotel and comes with hotel prices.  The food here at breakfast time is pretty damn good.  The pancakes are great and the eggs cooked perfectly.  I'm not sure what syrup they use for the pancakes, but its really good stuff.  The plates actually come out hot and pretty damn quick; so quick I wonder how they do it.  The coffee drinks were good too.  I must say, I had my doubts and had low expectations, but it isn't that bad.

I've also had lunch here twice recently, and I must say its pretty good.  I had the bbq pork sandwich and crab cakes as well as the fish and chips.  I checked with the chefs and the pork is slow roasted for about 4 hours. The crab cakes and crab sandwiches are freshly made with a home made remoulade.  The breads they use for the pork sandwich and crab cakes are really soft and good.  The fish for the fish and chips are made with fresh pacific snapper.  The clam chowder and french onion soup are really really good, also homemade in-house.  It surprises me that most of the items are freshly prepared as most hotels tend to stick with frozen products.  The salads are tasty and the  club sandwiches are pretty good too.   

The atmosphere is pretty nice.  The service was good and the staff were pretty friendly.  Nice open overhead with the atrium.  A very nice place to relax.  The prices are steep, as with most hotel restaurants, but the food I had definitely isn't lacking.

I seem to have a really good time every time I come into this hotel, although I've never tried dinner here before.
author: Phat Hippo L.

description: just stopped by for a quick drink. it was ok. kinda of up-tight bunch of crowd, what can you expect from a bar in the Hyatt. seating can range from private to public, most of the time the seats are reserved though.
author: Alex C.

description: Its worth the price (free).  The only reason we ate here is because breakfast was included with our room.  If we actually paid the standard price for the breakfast buffet ($26), this review would have taken an entirely different tone.  The highlight of breakfast was the cantelope (good) and cereal.  Everything else was close to inedible.
author: B A.

description: What an unfortunate restaurant.  I know you have a built in customer base, being in the Hyatt and all, but you should still try a little harder.  Our waiter was nice enough, but the food is overpriced for being so boring and flavorless.  Charging almost $20 for a chicken sandwich that didnt taste like anything, a side of burnt potato chips and a small side-salad is not okay.
author: brewgirl b.

description: I came here for dine about town. OMG! The service sucks. The food was nasty. I would not come back.
author: ALICE L.

description: I only had a quick bite here but I did enjoy the pasta I had. Sounds like it's not everyone's favourite place and the decor isn't great but it's not all bad.
author: Hui O.

description: I only go here when I crave their Pulled Pork Sandwich...That's the ONLY thing I liked there!  We used to come here often because it was directly across the street from our office and it was QUIET for a change.
author: Gio G.

description: I had reserved a table for 2:30 Thanksgiving day for their Thanksgiving Meal on Open Table.  It was supposed to be a special day. At 11:30 a.m. THANKSGIVING DAY I got a call from the restaurant saying they weren't serving their Thanksgiving meal until 4 pm. That was too late because we had other plans.  The restaurant did try to find us a reservation elsewhere.  The only thing they came up with was The Waterfront and it was a lot more expensive plus I didn't know what was on the menu.  The restaurant blames Open Table and I haven't heard back from them.  Ended up eating at Mel's Diner because it was the only place we could get in and out of in a reasonable time.  Not exactly what I had in mind for a special Thanksgiving dinner.  I don't feel I was treated fairly by the restaurant.  I guess it doesn't matter that they really ruined what was supposed to be a nice day with a very good friend.
author: David D.

description: I work in the Embarcaderos so find the convenience of eating here. It's a mixed bag depending on where you sit and who's serving you. I like the burgers once in a while.  Today, they had to do a redo as they burned the burger and the inside was too pink. Don't understand how they can make a delicious nonburned burger 2 weeks ago and today both burgers were inedible.  The women servers are more attentive then most of their men waiters.  Concepcion is excellent and is always the first to bring me some bread. Roni is another waitress that is totally aware of what her customers like and is on top of everything.  For the most part, the men waiters leave a lot to be desired.  There are a few who are attentive, and I guess it depends on what day of the week it is.  Really makes me mad when one of their managers comes out and apologizes for the lousy burger and tells me that's the way they cook them...Nope, I've had better there. I'm going to stop going there for a while.  Maybe they'll fire their Chinese chef and get someone who knows how to make a good burger.
author: Nina P.

description: I was staying at the Hyatt last weekend, visiting some family in the Bay Area, and had dinner at the Eclipse on a Saturday night. We were able to get seated quickly and the food was actually quite tasty and thoughtfully prepared. The service, however, was among the worst I have ever received. I had to ask for drinks (no wine list was provided, nor any wines by the glass explained), and the waiter offered no explanation of any of the selections. He served the wrong plates to several members of my party. The worst, however, is that I ordered a small salad to start and then a more substantial entree, as did everyone else at the table. However, when everyone else's entrees were served, the waiter did not bring mine. I waited a few moments. Nothing. I tried to wave him over. Nothing. Did not even look at me. Finally I was able to call his attention to our table. "Yes?" he asked. "Ummm," I said, "I don't have my food." "You didn't order anything," he said. "Yes, I did, " I replied. "I ordered the salmon." "No you didn't," he said. Another member of my party said, "yes, she did. I heard her," and he reluctantly placed the order. By the time I received my food, everyone was nearly done with theirs. Was an apology offered? No. Were dessert or drinks comped? No. Did the waiter ever come by to ask how the meal was, or if we needed another drink? Nope. Later, I read that the Hyatt is experiencing some labor problems (read: they are anti-union). They should work within the union to try to retain professional, experienced employees. As it stands now, I would never recommend the restaurant to anyone.
author: Kaye O.

description: the food here is not unpleasant.  it's really not.  i stayed at the hyatt for two days for work, and enjoyed a few free salads, a free breakfast, and some free cheesecake.  i really, really like free food, and i give it a lot of leeway in the quality and service departments.  indeed, i did not have to pay for or prepare anything myself, so if someone had just smirked and thrown my food at me, that would probably have been okay.  in fact, my caesar salad tasted quite good and i would gladly have paid $4 for it at pasta pomedoro.  and that, gentle readers, is where eclipse runs off the rails.  i wouldn't want to spend money here; it only encourages them.  hell, if someone else is paying, knock yourself out.  the starchy sides are way bland, but they seem to do well with chunks of meat and the aforementioned caesar salad.  the deserts are good.  i recommend the cheesecake.  service is indifferent, though there's one waiter there who really seems to be knocking himself out.  too bad he's the only one.
author: emmie k.
